title: Sallie Mae to Recruit at Upcoming Career Fair aboard Battleship New Jersey
text:
Sallie Mae to Recruit at Upcoming Career Fair aboard Battleship New Jersey [September 15, 2015] Tweet 
Sallie Mae - the nation's saving, planning, and paying for college company - will be recruiting for a variety of positions at the Philly Veterans Career Fair on Sept. 16 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. aboard the Battleship New Jersey, which is located on the Camden, N.J., riverfront at 100 Clinton St. Forty companies are participating in the fair, and approximately 300 active duty military servicemembers, veterans, and military spouses are expected to attend. 
Talent acquisition specialists from Sallie Mae will be on hand to discuss a wide range of career opportunities and conduct on-the-spot interviews. The company's current openings include jobs in information technology, customer service, internal audit, finance, vendor management, corporate security, risk management, quality control, human resources, and loan servicing. For more information about open positions, visit SallieMae.com/about/careers . 
"The men and women who have served our country come to the workplace with an intrinsic understanding of and appreciation for the values we prize at Sallie Mae, like collaboration, respect, and integrity," said Bonnie Beasley, senior vice president, human resources, Sallie Mae. "This career fair is a great way for us to connect military members with rewarding career opportunities at Sallie Mae." 
Organized by Veteran Recruiting the Philly Veterans Career Fair is open to all active-duty military servicemembers, veterans, and military spouses who are interested in working in the Greater Philadelphia area. Those interested in attending are encouraged to register in advance , upload their profiles to a website to which the on-site recruiters will have access, and schedule interviews. 
"We recognize the sacrifices members of the military have made on our behalf, and we are honored to have them on the Sallie Mae team," said Daniel Kennedy, senior vice president, chief information officer, Sallie Mae. Kennedy is a former Army officer who served tours of duty in Desert Storm and Somalia. 
Sallie Mae has a lengthy history of hiring veterans and their spouses, several of whom are featured on the company's website . In addition, the company has a dedicated customer service team that works exclusively with members of the military and their families. For more information about the benefits and resources available to military personnel, visit SallieMae.com/military . 
For more information on saving, planning, and paying for college, visit SallieMae.com . 
Sallie Mae (NASDAQ: SLM) is the nation's saving, planning, and paying for college company. Whether college is a long way off or just around the corner, Sallie Mae offers products that promote responsible personal finance, including private education loans, Upromise rewards, scholarship search, college financial planning tools, and online retail banking. Learn more at SallieMae.com . Commonly known as Sallie Mae, SLM Corporation and its subsidiaries are not sponsored by or agencies of the United States of America.
